web3-plugin-zksync
  • web3-plugin-zksync
  • SmartAccount

Class SmartAccount

A SmartAccount is a signer which can be configured to sign various payloads using a provided secret. The secret can be in any form, allowing for flexibility when working with different account implementations. The SmartAccount is bound to a specific address and provides the ability to define custom method for populating transactions and custom signing method used for signing messages, typed data, and transactions.

Hierarchy

  • AdapterL2
    • SmartAccount
  • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:44

Constructors

constructor

  • new SmartAccount(signer, provider?): SmartAccount

  • Creates a SmartAccount instance with provided signer and provider. By default, uses signPayloadWithECDSA and populateTransactionECDSA.

    Parameters

    • signer: SmartAccountSigner

      Contains necessary properties for signing payloads.

    • Optionalprovider: Web3ZKsyncL2

      The provider to connect to. Can be null for offline usage.

    Returns SmartAccount

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    Overrides AdapterL2.constructor

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:74

Properties

payloadSigner: PayloadSigner

Custom method for signing different payloads.

  • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:46

Methods

_contextL2

  • _contextL2(): Web3ZKsyncL2

  • Returns a context (provider + Signer) instance for connecting to an L2 network.

    Returns Web3ZKsyncL2

    Overrides AdapterL2._contextL2

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:85

_eip712Signer

  • _eip712Signer(): Promise<EIP712Signer>

  • Returns Promise<EIP712Signer>

    Inherited from AdapterL2._eip712Signer

    • Defined in src/adapters.ts:1770

connect

  • connect(provider?): SmartAccount

  • Creates a new instance of SmartAccount connected to a provider or detached from any provider if null is provided.

    Parameters

    • Optionalprovider: null | Web3ZKsyncL2

      The provider to connect the SmartAccount to. If null, the SmartAccount will be detached from any provider.

    Returns SmartAccount

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const sepoliaProvider = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const sepoliaAccount = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      sepoliaProvider
    );

    const mainnetProvider = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Mainnet);
    const mainnetAccount = sepoliaAccount.connect(mainnetProvider);
    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:128

getAddress

  • getAddress(): string

  • Returns string

    Overrides AdapterL2.getAddress

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:99

getAllBalances

  • getAllBalances(): Promise<WalletBalances>

  • Returns all token balances of the account.

    Returns Promise<WalletBalances>

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const balances = await account.getAllBalances();

    Overrides AdapterL2.getAllBalances

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:184

getBalance

  • getBalance(token?, blockTag?): Promise<bigint>

  • Returns the balance of the account.

    Parameters

    • Optionaltoken: string

      The token address to query balance for. Defaults to the native token.

    • OptionalblockTag: BlockTag = 'latest'

      The block tag to get the balance at.

    Returns Promise<bigint>

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const balance = await account.getBalance();

    Overrides AdapterL2.getBalance

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:161

getDeploymentNonce

  • getDeploymentNonce(): Promise<bigint>

  • Returns the deployment nonce of the account.

    Returns Promise<bigint>

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const nonce = await account.getDeploymentNonce();

    Overrides AdapterL2.getDeploymentNonce

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:207

  • Parameters

    • blockNumber: BlockNumberOrTag = 'latest'

    Returns Promise<bigint>

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:102

populateTransaction

  • populateTransaction(tx): Promise<Transaction | Eip712TxData>

  • Populates the transaction tx using the provided TransactionBuilder function. If tx.from is not set, it sets the value from the getAddress method which can be utilized in the TransactionBuilder function.

    Parameters

    • tx: Transaction | Eip712TxData

      The transaction that needs to be populated.

    Returns Promise<Transaction | Eip712TxData>

    Example

    import { constants, SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const populatedTx = await account.populateTransaction({
      type: constants.EIP712_TX_TYPE,
      to: "<RECEIVER>",
      value: 7_000_000_000,
    });

    Overrides AdapterL2.populateTransaction

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:238

sendRawTransaction

  • sendRawTransaction(signedTx): Promise<string>

  • Parameters

    • signedTx: string

    Returns Promise<string>

    Inherited from AdapterL2.sendRawTransaction

    • Defined in src/adapters.ts:1864

sendTransaction

  • sendTransaction(tx): Promise<PriorityOpResponse>

  • Sends tx to the Network. The signTransaction is called first to ensure transaction is properly signed.

    Parameters

    • tx: Transaction

      The transaction that needs to be sent.

    Returns Promise<PriorityOpResponse>

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const signedTx = await account.sendTransaction({
      to: "<RECEIVER>",
      value: 7_000_000_000,
    });
    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:312

signMessage

  • signMessage(message): string

  • Signs a message using the provided PayloadSigner function.

    Parameters

    • message: string | Uint8Array

      The message that needs to be signed.

    Returns string

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const signedMessage = await account.signMessage('Hello World!');

signTransaction

  • signTransaction(tx): Promise<string>

  • Signs the transaction tx using the provided PayloadSigner function, returning the fully signed transaction. The populateTransaction method is called first to ensure that all necessary properties for the transaction to be valid have been populated.

    Parameters

    • tx: Transaction | Eip712TxData

      The transaction that needs to be signed.

    Returns Promise<string>

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const signedTx = await account.signTransaction({
      to: "<RECEIVER>",
      value: 7_000_000_000,
    });

    Overrides AdapterL2.signTransaction

    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:277

signTypedData

  • signTypedData(domain, types, value): Promise<string>

  • Signs a typed data using the provided PayloadSigner function.

    Parameters

    • domain: TypedDataDomain

      The domain data.

    • types: Record<string, TypedDataField[]>

      A map of records pointing from field name to field type.

    • value: Record<string, any>

      A single record value.

    Returns Promise<string>

    Example

    import { SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const signedTypedData = await account.signTypedData(
      {name: 'Example', version: '1', chainId: 270},
      {
        Person: [
          {name: 'name', type: 'string'},
          {name: 'age', type: 'uint8'},
        ],
      },
      {name: 'John', age: 30}
    );
    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:380

transfer

  • transfer(transaction): Promise<PriorityOpResponse>

  • Transfer ETH or any ERC20 token within the same interface.

    Parameters

    • transaction: {
          amount: Numbers;
          overrides?: TransactionOverrides;
          paymasterParams?: PaymasterParams;
          to: string;
          token?: string;
      }

      Transfer transaction request.

      • amount: Numbers

        The address of the recipient.

      • Optionaloverrides?: TransactionOverrides

        The address of the recipient.

      • OptionalpaymasterParams?: PaymasterParams

        The address of the recipient.

      • to: string

        The address of the recipient.

      • Optionaltoken?: string

        The address of the recipient.

    Returns Promise<PriorityOpResponse>

    A Promise resolving to a transfer transaction response.

    Example: Transfer ETH.

    import { constants, SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const transferTx = await account.transfer({
      token: constants.ETH_ADDRESS,
      to: "<RECEIVER>",
      amount: 10_000_000n,
    });

    const receipt = await transferTx.wait();

    console.log(`The sum of ${receipt.value} ETH was transferred to ${receipt.to}`);

    Example: Transfer ETH using paymaster to facilitate fee payment with an ERC20 token.

    import { constants, paymasterUtils, SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const token = "0x927488F48ffbc32112F1fF721759649A89721F8F"; // Crown token which can be minted for free
    const paymaster = "0x13D0D8550769f59aa241a41897D4859c87f7Dd46"; // Paymaster for Crown token

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const transferTx = await account.transfer({
      to: Wallet.createRandom().address,
      amount: 10_000_000n,
      paymasterParams: paymasterUtils.getPaymasterParams(paymaster, {
        type: "ApprovalBased",
        token: token,
        minimalAllowance: 1,
        innerInput: new Uint8Array(),
      }),
    });

    const receipt = await transferTx.wait();

    console.log(`The sum of ${receipt.value} ETH was transferred to ${receipt.to}`);
    • Defined in src/smart-account.ts:540

transferTx

  • transferTx(transaction): Promise<Transaction>

  • Transfer ETH or any ERC20 token within the same interface.

    Parameters

    • transaction: {
          amount: Numbers;
          overrides?: TransactionOverrides;
          paymasterParams?: PaymasterParams;
          to: string;
          token?: string;
      }

      Transfer transaction request.

      • amount: Numbers

        The amount of the token to transfer.

      • Optionaloverrides?: TransactionOverrides

        Transaction's overrides which may be used to pass L2 gasLimit, gasPrice, value, etc.

      • OptionalpaymasterParams?: PaymasterParams

        Paymaster parameters.

      • to: string

        The address of the recipient.

      • Optionaltoken?: string

        The address of the token. Defaults to ETH.

    Returns Promise<Transaction>

    A Promise resolving to a transfer transaction response.

withdraw

  • withdraw(transaction): Promise<PriorityOpResponse>

  • Initiates the withdrawal process which withdraws ETH or any ERC20 token from the associated account on L2 network to the target account on L1 network.

    Parameters

    • transaction: {
          amount: Numbers;
          bridgeAddress?: string;
          overrides?: TransactionOverrides;
          paymasterParams?: PaymasterParams;
          to?: string;
          token: string;
      }

      Withdrawal transaction request.

      • amount: Numbers

        The amount of the token to withdraw.

      • OptionalbridgeAddress?: string

        The address of the bridge contract to be used.

      • Optionaloverrides?: TransactionOverrides

        Transaction's overrides which may be used to pass l2 gasLimit, gasPrice, value, etc.

      • OptionalpaymasterParams?: PaymasterParams

        Paymaster parameters.

      • Optionalto?: string

        The address of the recipient on L1.

      • token: string

        The address of the token. ETH by default.

    Returns Promise<PriorityOpResponse>

    A Promise resolving to a withdrawal transaction response.

    Example: Withdraw ETH.

    import { constants, SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const withdrawTx = await account.withdraw({
      token: constants.ETH_ADDRESS,
      amount: 10_000_000n,
    });

    Example: Withdraw ETH using paymaster to facilitate fee payment with an ERC20 token.

    import { constants, paymasterUtils, SmartAccount, types, Web3ZKsyncL2 } from "web3-plugin-zksync";

    const ADDRESS = "<ADDRESS>";
    const PRIVATE_KEY = "<PRIVATE_KEY>";

    const token = "0x927488F48ffbc32112F1fF721759649A89721F8F"; // Crown token which can be minted for free
    const paymaster = "0x13D0D8550769f59aa241a41897D4859c87f7Dd46"; // Paymaster for Crown token

    const l2 = Web3ZKsyncL2.initWithDefaultProvider(types.Network.Sepolia);
    const account = new SmartAccount(
      {address: ADDRESS, secret: PRIVATE_KEY},
      l2
    );

    const withdrawTx = await account.withdraw({
      token: constants.ETH_ADDRESS,
      amount: 10_000_000n,
      paymasterParams: paymasterUtils.getPaymasterParams(paymaster, {
        type: "ApprovalBased",
        token: token,
        minimalAllowance: 1,
        innerInput: new Uint8Array(),
      }),
    });

    Overrides AdapterL2.withdraw
